rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The preparation of dimethylaminoalkyl esters of indolecarboxylic acids.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The intention of this work was to produce 2-indolecarboxylic acids according to the method of Reissert, and to synthesize 3-indolecarboxylic acid from indole by means of the Grignard reagent, magnesyl indole. These acids were to be esterified with dimethylaminoethanol and 1- dimethylaminopropanol-2. Since it was known that dialkylaminoethyl esters of aromatic acids generally possess anaesthetic activity, it was expected that these dimethylaminoalkyl indolecarboxylates would also be anaesthetics.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Chemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Aviation law in Canada.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: There can be little quarrel in Canada with the saying "the history of civilization is the history of transportation". Before the advent of the railway, settlement and civilization in the Dominion was confined to the sea coasts and to the banks of our great river systems. These "scattered and weak boundaries" of "a number of inconsiderable colonies”, as one of the Fathers of Confederation with some rhetorical exaggeration phrased it, “isolated and feeble", were dispersed along a narrow belt of territory from the Atlantic to the Pacific. Intercourse with the interior was hazardous and uncertain; the fur trade flourished but commerce, in the modern sense, was unknown.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Law.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The effect of management on soil organic matter.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The current trend towards more specialisation and mechanisation in farming practices in the province of Quebec poses the need for assessing the effects of management on the organic matter status of the soil. Such information is usually obtained from long-term manurial experiments requiring from ten to twenty years. To be of practical value, however, this assessment should be done more rapidly than is possible by the above-mentioned method. The purpose of this investigation, therefore, was to assess as rapidly as possible the affect of management on the organic matter status of a soil type common in the province of Quebec.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Agronomy.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The effect of chloride on the deposition of copper, in the presence of arsenic, antimony and bismuth.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The importance of addition agents in the electrodeposition of metals is well established. Although it is widely known that these substances, when added to an electrolyte, are capable of modifying the physical nature of a metal deposit, the problem of how they function has yet to be solved. To gain an insight into the mechanism by which addition agents act, many studies have been made, a large body of data, much of which is contradictory, has been obtained and various theories of their action have been proposed.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Chemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The serum lipids in atherosclerosis.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The pathogenesis of atherosclerosis may be considered basically as the interaction of three phases, (a) the circulating blood and substances carried by it, (b) the endothelial membrane and (c) the reaction pattern of the vascular subendothelium. In this thesis, we have undertaken to review recent additions to our knowledge of the substances in the circulating blood, which are believed to be concerned in the genesis of atherosclerosis. During the past forty years, a vast literature has accumulated concerning the serum phase in atherosclerosis and this may indeed be considered the chemical era of research in the subject.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Experimental Medicine.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: L’esthetique de la fontaine.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: De prime abord l'oeuvre de La Fontaine se distingue de l'oeuvre des autres écrivains classiques. Il est un peu a part dans le siècle dans ce canton des "Fables" et des "Contes" dont il est comme prisonnier. Cependant quand il discourt sur son art il semble bien proche de ses amis et se réclame de la même esthétique qu'eux. La première partie de notre travail va consister à voir ce que La Fontaine pense de la poétique classique. On examinera surtout ses écrits "théoriques", ses préfaces, ou des réflexions semées au hasard dans ses oeuvres, pour voir en quoi il est d'accord avec les idées des autres auteurs classiques. Dans la deuxième partie, c'est l'oeuvre même de La Fontaine qui sera passée en revue pour voir si elle répond à cet idéal invoqué par le poète.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: French.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Problems of capital formation in underdeveloped countries with special consideration of capital imports and balance of payments problems.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Since the termination of the hostilities in 1945, the literature dealing with economic development has been constantly increasing. While the economic discussion of the nineteen twenties and thirties was strongly influenced by the great depression, the emphasis has shifted since the war to the question: "why are come countries ‘rich’, while others are 'poor'?" Many attempts to solve this problem are primarily empirical in nature, offering specific recommendations for specific cases.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Economics.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: An indoor method for measurement of back-scattering coefficients.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: An indoor method for measurement of the back-scattering of short radio waves is described. The scatterer is illuminated by a quasi-plane wave generated by collimating the field from a point source by a microwave lens. It is shown that the back-scattering coefficients of metal discs of radii one to six to wavelengths can be measured with considerable accuracy using a lens thirty-three wavelengths in diameter. Backscattering by circular cylinders also is discussed. Perturbations of the back-scattered fields, due to diffraction by the finite lens aperture are evaluated theoretically. Two new features of the diffraction fields associated with lenses are explained: the field in the plane of a circular aperture, due to incident spherical waves, is predicted by an empirical equation; the field near the surface of a dielectric lens is explained qualitatively. Investigations on an isotropic artificial dielectric, and on a lens constructed from it, are described.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Physics.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The geology of the Nipissis River and Nipisso Lake map-areas.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The rocks of the two map-areas include paragneisses and acidic and basic intrusives. More than three-quarters of the rocks are of igneous origin; granitic types predominate. In the Nipissis River area granitic rocks are found west and north of the Nipissis and Nipisso Rivers, whereas basic intrusives are found east and south of the two rivers. A narrow band of paragneisses and migmatites separates the two main rock groups. Granitic rocks occupy the southern third, except for the southeast corner, and most of the northern quarter of the Nipisso Lake area.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Geological Sciences.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: An investigation of potassium fixation by some eastern Canadian soils.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The term “fixation”, as first applied in the field of soil chemistry, was in reference to the fixation of nitrogen, where in atmospheric nitrogen is converted microbiologically, or otherwise, to a form that can be utilized by plants. This process is obviously a beneficial one and is in no way comparable to the fixation that occurs when phosphorus or potassium is converted from the water soluble or the exchangeable form to the non-exchangeable state. Fixation, in the case of nitrogen, increases the supply available to the plant.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Agricultural Chemistry.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The aircraft operator’s liability.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: International Private Air Law has become a field of international legislation in scope only comparable to and even developing beyond Maritime Law. On the term "International Private Law" some remarks should be noted; Beaumont distinguishes these terms for purposes of International Law; Private International Law which term is equivalent to the term “Law of Conflicts" and International Private Law which Beaumont uses as a synonym for "unified law governing the relations of private individuals which is common to many nations and in that sense international." (Shawcross and Beaumont on Air Law, 1st Edition, 1945, Nos. 11,12,16)
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Law.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Perception as a function of retinal locus.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The fact that one is capable of recognizing an object when the image falls on different parts of the retina is one of the most perplexing which has confronted psychological theorists. Implicit in this phenomenon are all the problems of learning as well as perception. The nature of the memory trace, the degree of innate organization of the nervous system, the very nature of perception itself have been involved in the speculations of those who have attempted to account for it.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Psychology.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: New isomeric transitions of short life in gold, mercury and thallium.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The work described in this thesis is concerned with the measurement of gamma-ray energies with a NaI scintillation spectrometer and thereby, the identification of new isomers produced in gold, mercury and thallium by proton bombardment in the McGill cyclotron. Soon after Breckon and Martin had set up their equipment for the study of short-lived radioactivities, survey experiments indicated unknown activities in several elements under proton bombardment. When gold or platinum was irradiated at increasing energies, the period, which at low energies was of the order of 7 seconds, seemed to become shorter. However, the results of this preliminary experiment were considered inconclusive due to trouble with the equipment used.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Physics.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Neutron yields in p, n reactions.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The relative neutron yields of beryllium, copper, and aluminum under proton bombardment in the McGill Synchrocyclotron have been obtained using a scintillation counter as a detector, with a crystal whose efficiency for gamma ray detection was negligible compared to its efficiency for neutron detection. The measurements were made at incident proton energies of 30 and 40 Mev. The results are not very different from relative yield measurements made at 340 Mev.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Physics.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Complaints in families known to a child guidance clinic.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: This study is concerned with the concept of complaints. The complaints of a group of families, whose children were referred to the Mental Hygiene Institute of Montreal, have been collected and examined. These complaints have been directed against the physical, psychological and social fields. The study itself forms the initial section of a larger study aimed at discovering why it is that children born in the same family and living in the same environment do not exhibit similar patterns of adaptation when faced with similar traumatic events. The term adaptation has been used in preference to the term disease to emphasize that a state of disease does not exist unless a dynamically adapting organism is actually resisting frustrating forces external to it.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Social Work.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Studies in therapy of hemorrhagic shock with associated myocardial damage.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Increasing interest in the use of intra-arterial transfusion to combat the more refractory forms of shock has been apparent in the recent literature. Included amongst those forms of shock which react favourably to this form of therapy is the hypotension which occasionally follows an acute myocardial infarction. The easy availability of stored human blood with the advent of community blood banks has resulted in a very marked increase in the amount of blood used both therapeutically and prophylactically.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Experimental Surgery.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Correlations between high frequency and low frequency noise in a high frequency oscillator.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The noise appearing as a modulation on the radio frequency energy generated by oscillators has been examined. These measurements have revealed a new effect: flicker noise and shot noise, generated within a tube at very low frequencies, modulates the radio frequency oscillation and in doing it produces radio frequency noise. At frequencies close to the carrier this noise greatly exceeds the noise from all previously recognized sources. Spectrum and correlation measurements have been made on bath the audio frequency and the radio frequency noise generated simultaneously by an oscillator tube. The spectra of the radio frequency and the audio frequency noises corresponded. Other measurements showed that the noise trains were as much as seventy percent correlated up to the limit of measurement, namely 10 kilocycles per second different for the carrier frequency. A method is provided for the calculation of the magnitude of the noise arising from this source.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Physics.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Feldspar deposits of the Johan Beetz area.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The region described under this heading is located in the Grenville Province of the Canadian Shield. The description includes about three hundred square miles surrounding the feldspar deposits. The topography of the area is greatly influenced by the structure of the bedrock. Near the sea, where the land surface is low, bays and peninsulas form an irregular shoreline. Shape and location of the bays are determined by the strike and extant of the softer sedimentary rocks which underlie the submerged valleys.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Geological Sciences.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The rights of the minority shareholder.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: There are some general considerations which may be useful in attempting to understand the attitude of the legislator and the judge to the problem of the company minority. The question of minority rights has in general received much more attention in public law than it has in connection with limited companies. The development of principles and institutions for the protection of the political, racial or ethnic minority has no counterpart in the field of company law. In certain democratic states we now have in proportional representation, for example, a technique for stressing minority representation. One hardly finds trace of such emphasis in the commercial law.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Law.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Mono-kinetic ion source for a single focusing mass spectrograph.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The design, construction and performance of a hot-cathode oscillating electron mono-kinetic source of positive ions are described. The source is designed for a single-focusing mass spectrograph for the mass-identification of radioactive positive ions. Electrons from a hot cathode focused by a weak magnetic field (400 gausses), oscillate in a reflection type electric field to generate positive ions in a metallic vapour issuing from an internal furnace. Positive ions are partially focused by the electron space charge. The source is mono-kinetic within 3 volts. Positive ion currents of 3 x 10-9 A of Cadmium were obtained at moderate furnace temperatures for electron space currents of 15 ul.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Physics.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Radioautographic localization of C14 in tissues of rats following administration of C14-labeled bicarbonate.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Modern histology is concerned principally with attempts to correlate the precise order which exists in the organization of organs and tissues at a microscopic level with the biological functions of these structures. Out of the increased need for knowledge of such structural functional relationships has grown the branch of histological study known as histochemistry. Its researches are dedicated to the development of new and useful chemical, physical and biological techniques which may be applied at the cellular or tissue level for the elucidation of such varied functions as, for example, enzyme action, secretion, or reproduction.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Anatomy.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: On the use of time-concepts in the theory of production and of capital.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The writer of an inquiry of specialized scope often finds it unavoidable to use certain concepts, the satisfactory definition of which (if any such definition may be formulated at all) might be attempted only by applying a much broader approach. Among these concepts belongs that of Time: it is indeed almost certain that in this case no manner of inquiry other than philosophy is suited to provide tools of analysis. On the other hand time necessarily enters as an element of any economic argument unless such an argument is restricted to operating within the framework of most simplified, unrealistic assumptions.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Economics.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: On the age, growth, migratory habits and reproductive potential of the arctic char (Salvelinus alpinus) of Frobisher Bay, Baffin Island.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: While references to the Arctic char (Salvelinus alpinus L.) in the literature of the northern regions are numerous, studies devoted to various aspects of the biology of this important and widely ranging species are few. No extensive study on the growth rate of the Arctic char has been found, nor has growth been the subject of more than superficial attention in the small number of works discovered which have dealt with it. Migratory habits have been discussed more frequently, but observers have not been sufficiently long at one place to observe extensively the migratory movements of a single population.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Zoology.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The evaluation of comparative yield trials of maize for silage.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: A number of sources of variation which may influence the evaluation of comparative yield trials of silage corn were investigated in 1951, namely, the effect of maturity, diurnal changes in percentage dry matter, and the variability of duplicate samples. In 1952 several proposed methods of evaluating comparative yield trials were compared with the "Standard Method" presently in use at Macdonald College. Inconsistent exceptions precluded the possibility of separating varieties into three distinct classes according to their green yield ranks, with the object of eliminating the class with the lowest yield. A "Whole Ear Method" in which unchopped ears were sampled was of comparable accuracy to the "Standard Method" of harvesting. "Methods of Combining Green Plant Materials" and the "Standard Method" produced comparable data; complications of field operation inherent in the former methods preclude their extended use. It may not be necessary to samp1e every replication for percentage dry matter estimations.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Agronomy.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: On the theory of radiative transitions in heavy nuclei.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: A complete description of the low-energy radiation from a single nucleon moving in a central field is presented. The electric and magnetic multipole matrix elements, and the corresponding transition strengths, are calculated. The angular corrections to the Weisskopf estimates determined in this way are found to be considerable in the case of magnetic type radiations and have the effect of lowering the experimental transition probabilities well below the theoretical ones.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Mathematics.
